description: A secret underground hideout for the Dark Brotherhood, nestled in the forests of Falkreath Hold. Its entrance is a Black Door carved into stone, which asks a cryptic question to test those who seek entry.

entrance_security.entry_requirements: Dark Brotherhood membership or correct passphrase knowledge

status.condition_notes: May change to 'destroyed' if the Sanctuary is attacked in the storyline.

notable_members: Cicero (Keeper of the Night Mother, present only if not eliminated during questline)
Night Mother (corpse of the Dark Brotherhood's unholy matron, hidden in a coffin â€“ becomes relevant later in questline)

features.training_area: Space for combat practice in a side cavern
features.living_quarters: Sleeping alcoves and a common room for members
features.night_mother_chamber: A sealed chamber holding the Night Mother's coffin (initially, only Cicero interacts here)
features.escape_tunnel: A hidden exit in case the Sanctuary is compromised

triggers.description: Prints a scene with the Black Door's challenge (the door asks: 'What is the music of life?').
Prints a welcome scene with Brotherhood members greeting the player.
If the Sanctuary is attacked (e.g., Penitus Oculatus in 'Death Incarnate'), mark condition as 'destroyed' and describe burning chaos.

quest_association: Dark Brotherhood main questline (from recruitment to 'Hail Sithis!')
Alternate quest 'Destroy the Dark Brotherhood' (if player chose to betray them)
gm_notes: The Sanctuary remains hidden to players until they either join the Dark Brotherhood or discover the Black Door through exploration and know the passphrase. It serves as a hub for assassination quests. The atmosphere inside is tense but familial among members. Ensure to update 'status.discovered' and 'status.accessible' in campaign state when players join or find the Sanctuary.
